data.title: Acorna Unicorn Girl by Anne Mccaffrey, First Edition
data.meta_description: Acorna: The Unicorn Girl (Acorna series, 1) by McCaffrey, Anne; Ball, Margaret and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. First Edition; First Printing. 1st US edition; hbk in d/w; stated 1st edition; probably read carefully once; previous owner's rubber book stamp, with name in, on fep (not author) ; not price clipped; ; Acorna Series; 9.0 X 6.0 X 1.2 inches; 320 pages.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. HarperPrism 1997 First Edition First Printing Bruised at top and base of spine and page edges browning else Fine book in like Dust Jacket ''. She was just a little girl. With a tiny horn in the center of her forehead, funny-looking feet, beautiful silver hair, and several curious powers: the ability to purify air and water, make plants grow, and heal scars and broken bones. Acorna's rough-and-ready 'uncles'. took their foundling. all the way to the bandit planet. where no questions are asked, and a girl might grow up free.'' First of the trilogy. Book.

hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: DJ: Very Good. 1st ptg. 314 pp. 6 1/4 x 9 1/2. Tan boards, blind embossed on front, with qtr gray cloth, stamped in gold on spine. Glossy mostly yellow dj. No damage or markings noted.

Mass Market Paperback. Condition: Collectable, very good. 1st. First printings of the first four books in the "Acorna" series. VG+ or better condition--very slight wear, clean, no marks or writing, sound bindings although the binding of "Unicorn Girl" is very slightly wear. `** We are a small family business selling fine new and pre-owned books online since 1999. We provide professional service and individual attention to your order, daily shipments, and sturdy packaging.

Hardcover first edition - First printing. The first book in a new trilogy. "She was just a little girl. With a tiny horn in the center of her forehead, funny-looking feet, beautiful silver hair, and several curious powers: the ability to purify air and water, make plants grow, and heal scars and broken bones. . . Acorna's rough-and-ready 'uncles'. took their foundling back at knifepoint . . . all the way to the bandit planet Kezdet, where no questions are asked, and a girl might grow up free." 291 pp. Wraparound dust jacket art by John Ennis. Near fine in a fine dust jacket (a tight, straight copy but significant toning to the pages).

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. Publisher: HarperCollins, 2001. First Edition, First Printing. Hardcover is in very good+ condition ("3-15-02" is written in blue ink on the top corner of the inside of the front cover; otherwise in near-fine condition). Dust jacket is in near-fine condition. Brodart protected. 292 pages. Size: 8vo - over 7¾" - 9¾" tall. Acorna's people, the Linyaari, are once more without a home. And though they survived the brutal attack from the cold-blooded Khleevi, the battle left their beloved planet, narhii-Vhiliinyar, horribly scarred.

Hardcover. First Edition; First Printing. Very Good in a Very Good dust jacket. ; 1.3 x 9.1 x 6 Inches; 291 pages.

Hardcover. Condition: vg. First edition, first printing. Quarto. [6], 314pp. Original illustrated dust-jacket over paper covered boards, with gold lettering on spine. Title-page signed by Anne McCaffrey. In this new opus, award-winning author Elizabeth Ann Scarborough joins Anne McCaffrey to continue the saga of the beloved character of the Unicorn girl in a story that will delight every fan and win new hearts, too. Dust-jacket, binding and interior in very good condition.
